alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Iron and southeastern Ashland Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 514 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Glidden, or 11 miles west of Turtle Flambeau Flowage, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Iron and southeastern Ashland Counties, including the following locations... Long Lake, Gile Flowage, Van Buskirk, Island Lake Iron County and Fisher Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
